subject: Sales
title: Nike: Just Do It
description: A short lesson to help you apply Nike: Just Do It.

hook.text: Three words turned a shoe company into a cultural movement. 'Just Do It' became a global mantra.

buildup.text: Nike doesn't sell shoes. It sells the emotional experience of athletic achievement and personal victory.

discovery.text: Every Nike ad whispers: you can be the champion. The shoes are simply the vehicle for aspiration.

twist.text: Nike has faced factory controversies. The brand survived because emotional loyalty is that powerful.

climax.text: Emotion-first branding creates customers who identify with the brand, not just wear the product.

punchline.text: Nike proves emotion outsells features every time.

quiz.question: What does Nike actually sell according to its branding strategy?
